item.title: Phivan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Where there is no hope, it is incumbent on us to invent it." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Immanuel Kant
item.description: "Act in such a way that you treat humanity, whether in your own person or in the person of any other, never merely as a means to an end, but always at the same time as an end." -- Immanuel Kant

item.title: Phivan add a quote by William James Dally
item.description: "The greatest use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it." -- William James Dally

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Do not fear death so much, but rather the inadequate life" -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "This is my simple religion. No need for temples. No need for complicated philosophy. Your own mind, your own heart is the temple. Your philosophy is simple kindness." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Phivan add a quote by T.E. Lawrence
item.description: "All men dream: but not equally. Those who dream by night in the dusty recesses of their minds wake up in the day to find it was vanity, but the dreamers of the day are dangerous men, for they may act their dreams with open eyes, to make it possible." -- T.E. Lawrence

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Evelyn Beatrice Hall
item.description: "I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it." -- Evelyn Beatrice Hall

item.title: Phivan add a quote by William James
item.description: "A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices." -- William James

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Immanuel Kant
item.description: "Seek not the favor of the multitude; it is seldom got by honest and lawful means. But seek the testimony of few; and number not voices, but weigh them." -- Immanuel Kant

item.title: Phivan add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "This is the true joy in life, the being used for a purpose recognized by yourself as a mighty one; the being thoroughly worn out before you are thrown on the scrap heap; the being a force of Nature instead of a feverish selfish little clod of ailments and grievances complaining that the world will not devote itself to making you happy." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Tao Te Ching
item.description: "To have without possessing, Do without claiming, Lead without controlling, This is mysterious power." -- Tao Te Ching

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." -- Aristotle

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Leo Marks
item.description:
"The life that I have Is all that I have And the life that I have Is yours
The love that I have Of the life that I have Is yours and yours and yours
A sleep I shall have A rest I shall have Yet death will be but a pause For the peace of my years In the long green grass Will be yours and yours and yours." -- Leo Marks

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "It always seems impossible until it's done." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Gautama Siddharta
item.description: "Believe nothing just because a so-called wise person said it. Believe nothing just because a belief is generally held. Believe nothing just because it is said in ancient books. Believe nothing just because it is said to be of divine origin. Believe nothing just because someone else believes it. Believe only what you yourself test and judge to be true." -- Gautama Siddharta

item.title: Phivan add a quote by John O'Donoghue
item.description: "The duty of privilege is absolute integrity." -- John O'Donoghue

item.title: Phivan add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "You don't write because you want to say something, you write because you have something to say." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not; a sense of humor to console him for what he is." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "If we are to have peace on earth, our loyalties must become ecumenical rather than sectional. Our loyalties must transcend our race, our tribe, our class, and our nation; and this means we must develop a world perspective." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The secret of happiness is this: let your interest be as wide as possible and let your reactions to the things and persons who interest you be as far as possible friendly rather than hostile. " -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Phivan add a quote by thomas paine
item.description: "Independence is my happiness, and I view things as they are, without regard to place or person; my country is the world, and my religion is to do good." -- thomas paine

item.title: Phivan add a quote by William Wilberforce
item.description: "You may choose to look the other way but you can never say again that you did not know." -- William Wilberforce

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Phivan add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Sanskrit
item.description: "Self mastery is the quality of a king. Be vigilant in your control over the self. If you cannot respond to your will, how can you expect others to respond? " -- Sanskrit

item.title: Phivan add a quote by Tao Te Ching
Phivan add a quote by Rilke Rainer Maria
item.description: "Once the realization is accepted that even between the closest human beings infinite distances continue, a wonderful living side by side can grow, if they succeed in loving the distance between them which makes it possible for each to see the other whole against the sky." -- Rilke Rainer Maria
